content:
• Friday, June 29, 2012
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -19.1%) closed with a market cap of $3.8B. After backing out...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -19.1%) closed with a market cap of $3.8B. After backing out cash/investments, that spells an enterprise value of just $1.6B, or $3.10/share. Of course, some of that cash is likely to burned in the coming quarters by hardware losses and restructuring costs. That leads Barclays to predict RIM's cash balance will fall to $3/share from a current $4.40/share by the time BlackBerry 10 launches. Expected outflows lead MKM to value RIM's cash at just $2/share. (more) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM | 9 Comments
  • OIIM

    Analog and security chipmaker O2Micro (NASDAQ:OIIM) falls 11.6% AH after warning it expects Q2...

    Analog and security chipmaker O2Micro (NASDAQ:OIIM) falls 11.6% AH after warning it expects Q2 revenue of $27.9M-$28.5M, below a prior guidance range of $30.3M-$31.8M and a consensus of $31M. In a troubling sign for the chip industry, which has seen evidence of a stalled recovery mount, O2Micro attributes the warning to "broad-based weakness in demand."

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • TIBX

    Tibco (TIBX +11.5%) ended the day with a big gain after beating FQ2 estimates and providing...

    Tibco (TIBX +11.5%) ended the day with a big gain after beating FQ2 estimates and providing reassuring FQ3 guidance. The company also fired Americas sales chief Robin Gilthorpe as part of a reorg. During its earnings call, Tibco noted Asia-Pac sales rose 40% Y/Y in FQ2, helping offset a mere 4% increase in Euro sales, where IT spending (like much else) has come under pressure. Also, the company's BPM software sales rose 80%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • VIVHY

    Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY) is seeking a buyer for its 61%, $8.1B stake in Activision (ATVI +4.4%),...

    Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY) is seeking a buyer for its 61%, $8.1B stake in Activision (ATVI +4.4%), Bloomberg reports. It's added that if no buyer emerges, Vivendi will sell part of its stake on the open market. With Vivendi undergoing a CEO shake-up and chairman Jean-Rene Fourtou under pressure to restructure, other asset sales could also be on the way.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • MWE

    MarkWest Energy (MWE +2.2%) completes a $300M increase to its senior secured revolving credit...

    MarkWest Energy (MWE +2.2%) completes a $300M increase to its senior secured revolving credit facility, increasing total borrowing capacity to $1.2B, and extends the maturity of the revolving credit facility by one year to Sept. 2017.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • UNH

    Following a brief rebound at the open today, health insurance stocks resume their downward...

    Following a brief rebound at the open today, health insurance stocks resume their downward trajectory on the back of yesterday's Supreme Court decision: UnitedHealth (UNH -2.5%), WellPoint (WLP -3.2%), Aetna (AET -3%), HealthNet (HNT -0.7%) and Coventry Health Care (CVH -2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 16 Comments
  • YPF

    Argentina's YPF (YPF +4.2%) says it's now fully complying with NYSE listing requirements and its...

    Argentina's YPF (YPF +4.2%) says it's now fully complying with NYSE listing requirements and its shares will no longer be traded as a "below compliance" company. YPF stopped meeting NYSE compliance after the Argentine government said it would expropriate a 51% stake in the company from its majority owner, Spain's Repsol YPF. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • EHTH

    eHealth (EHTH +4.8%) gets a pop from a BofA Merrill Lynch upgrade to Buy on the heels of the...

    eHealth (EHTH +4.8%) gets a pop from a BofA Merrill Lynch upgrade to Buy on the heels of the Supreme Court decision yesterday. BofA says the company sells individual and family insurance policies, and the law's mandate will more than double its available market.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • MNST

    Energy drinks continue to be all the rage, according to Nielsen data analyzed by Goldman Sachs...

    Energy drinks continue to be all the rage, according to Nielsen data analyzed by Goldman Sachs analyst Judy Hong. Monster Beverage (MNST +3.1%) saw a sales gain of 28% in recent tracking led by its Rehab drink, while Red Bull - the prize of Austria's Red Bull GmbH - grew at a 30% clip and improved its market share. The continued sales gains in the energy drink sector have been impressive, with analysts seeing even more upside based on the trend that over 56% of purchases are currently being made in bars and other outlets away from homes.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • BP

    BP (BP +4.5%) says it will suspend consultations with Gazprom (OTCPK:OGZPY) over a possible...

    BP (BP +4.5%) says it will suspend consultations with Gazprom (OTCPK:OGZPY) over a possible pipeline to supply Russian gas to the U.K. after its troublesome Russian oil partners refused to allow the talks. This week, BP reportedly was denied when it asked for a waiver to allow discussions on possibly participating in the Nord Stream project.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • BNO

    A massive (9.2% and counting) rally in WTI crude has erased in one day the entirety of June's...

    A massive (9.2% and counting) rally in WTI crude has erased in one day the entirety of June's decline. Talk about due for a bounce - in the 8 weeks prior to today, oil had fallen in nearly a straight line from $106/barrel to $78. Brent crude's (NYSEARCA:BNO) a slacker, up just 7%. (see also)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 8 Comments
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC (WFR +3.5%) follows its solar peers higher after announcing its SunEdison subsidiary has...

    MEMC (WFR +3.5%) follows its solar peers higher after announcing its SunEdison subsidiary has sold a 20MW Nevada solar project to Southern Company (NYSE:SO) and Turner Renewable Energy. MEMC can definitely use the proceeds - it had $2.1B in debt on its balance sheet as of March 30, has been burning cash at a rapid pace, and has recently been hit with credit rating downgrades. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • ANTH

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH -8.5%) continues its fall from yesterday as Citigroup cuts the...

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH -8.5%) continues its fall from yesterday as Citigroup cuts the shares to Sell High-Risk, and slashes its price target from $2 to $0.50. Citi says that while blisibimod demonstrated a trend in improved clinical response, successful phase 3 testing remains risky and there are few catalysts other than a potential dilutive financing given the need to raise capital just to get through phase 3.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM

  • Gold and oil both soar, with gold settling above the key $1,600/oz. psychological mark and crude...

    Gold and oil both soar, with gold settling above the key $1,600/oz. psychological mark and crude oil up 7.7% with settlement less than an hour away. But one group of traders is very wrong: Either the European financial crisis is fixed - as energy prices rise on an anticipated increase in demand - or it isn't - as gold prices rise as investors seek a safe haven.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 18 Comments
  • CELG

    Celgene (CELG +2.8%) gains on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Argus, citing the company's...

    Celgene (CELG +2.8%) gains on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Argus, citing the company's reiterated guidance following the Revlimid setback.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • PHM

    Homebuilder stocks are getting a lift from KB Homes upbeat FQ2 earnings report: XHB +3.8%, PHM...

    Homebuilder stocks are getting a lift from KB Homes upbeat FQ2 earnings report: XHB +3.8%, PHM +5.4%, DHI +4.7%, TOL +3.8%, MDC +3.7%, NVR +1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • BIIB

    Biogen Idec (BIIB +2%) and Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS +2.8%) enter into an agreement to develop...

    Biogen Idec (BIIB +2%) and Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS +2.8%) enter into an agreement to develop and commercialize an antisense drug for the treatment of Steinert disease. Isis will receive an upfront payment of $12M and is responsible for the discovery of a lead drug candidate. In all, the deal could see Isis rake in more than $271M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM | 6 Comments
  • NKE

    The post-mortem continues in full force on Nike (NKE -11.1%) after a lackluster FQ4 report spurs...

    The post-mortem continues in full force on Nike (NKE -11.1%) after a lackluster FQ4 report spurs traders to lop off close to $3B from Nike's market cap due primarily to weak growth in China. Sterne Agee advises that investors stay on the sidelines as FY13 plays out, on an expectation that as Nike's revenue fades from strong Olympics-related sales, China will come back into focus.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • ORCL

    Oracle (ORCL +4.4%) receives an upgrade to Outperform from RBC's Robert Breza, who is more...

    Oracle (ORCL +4.4%) receives an upgrade to Outperform from RBC's Robert Breza, who is more positive on the enterprise software giant now that visibility for its seasonally-weak August quarter has improved. Breza's positive catalysts: improved sales productivity, a $10B stock buyback program, the ramp of Fusion cloud apps, and greater visibility for Oracle's cloud ops in general following this month's big product launch.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • NAVB

    ThinkEquity initiates coverage on a slew of drug developers with a Buy rating this morning:...

    ThinkEquity initiates coverage on a slew of drug developers with a Buy rating this morning: Navidea (NAVB +3.7%), BioMarin (BMRN +4.5%), Corcept Therapeutics (CORT +4%), Medivation (MDVN +5.2%), Amicus Theraputics (FOLD +2%), Raptor Pharmaceuticals (RPTP +0.2%), Synageva BioPharma (GEVA +3.2%), Aegerion (GEVA +3.7%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • NAV

    More drama with Navistar (NYSE:NAV): After OTR Global kicked up enthusiasm by saying that the...

    More drama with Navistar (NYSE:NAV): After OTR Global kicked up enthusiasm by saying that the company may offer Cummins (CMI +4.1%) engines, a Navistar spokeswoman seemed to deflate the idea a bit by calling it "speculation" as she declined further comment. Shares are still up 11.5%, with M&A chatter remaining a major backdrop.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 4 Comments
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +5%), the first company to win approval to export natural gas from the...

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +5%), the first company to win approval to export natural gas from the continental U.S., plans to complete up to $4B of financing to build liquefaction units for its Sabine Pass facility in the next few days, CEO Charif Souki says. Overseas firms already have agreed to buy a combined 16M tons/year from Sabine Pass, LNG says.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 3 Comments
  • ITRI

    Itron (ITRI +4.6%) jumps after announcing its smart water meters have been adopted by Sydney...

    Itron (ITRI +4.6%) jumps after announcing its smart water meters have been adopted by Sydney Water, an Australia utility that serves over 4.6M people. Sydney will commence a 3-year project to replace traditional meters with Itron's solutions on July 1. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • NOK

    On a day when most Euro tech stocks are rocketing higher, Nokia (NOK -1.4%) isn't. One likely...

    On a day when most Euro tech stocks are rocketing higher, Nokia (NOK -1.4%) isn't. One likely reason: The latest chapter to the Research In Motion (RIMM) fiasco has investors worried about low-end/mid-range phone demand, and the future of any mobile OEM not tied to iOS or Android. A small piece of good news comes from Flickr, which is joining Microsoft in adopting Nokia Maps.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems' (AONE -5.9%) cash balance continues to shrink after the company yesterday filed an...

    A123 Systems' (AONE -5.9%) cash balance continues to shrink after the company yesterday filed an amended S-3 detailing its financial situation. Wunderlich says that at the current cash burn rate, AONE will need $400M more over the next 18 months just to survive and reiterates its Sell rating with a $0.50 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 4 Comments
  • SNE

    Sony (SNE +3.5%) wins approval with the FTC to lead a consortium to buy EMI Music. Previously,...

    Sony (SNE +3.5%) wins approval with the FTC to lead a consortium to buy EMI Music. Previously, the company landed approval in Europe for the deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy (BTU +3.5%) leases 721M tons of ultra-low-sulfur coal reserves adjacent to its...

    Peabody Energy (BTU +3.5%) leases 721M tons of ultra-low-sulfur coal reserves adjacent to its North Antelope Rochelle Mine in the Powder River Basin of Wyoming. BTU has leased more than 1.1B tons of reserves adjacent to North Antelope Rochelle in recent months, and it controls 4B tons of coal reserves in the region.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • DIOD

    Diodes (DIOD +6.2%) rallies after Needham starts coverage with a Buy and $20 PT. The firm...

    Diodes (DIOD +6.2%) rallies after Needham starts coverage with a Buy and $20 PT. The firm praises the analog chipmaker's manufacturing abilities, which have helped it gain share, and thinks the company is well-positioned to grow rapidly during the chip industry's next up-cycle.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • EQNR

    Norway's oil strike could be on the verge of winding down, as the Oil Industry Association says...

    Norway's oil strike could be on the verge of winding down, as the Oil Industry Association says it's open to new talks and unions suggest new solutions to a pension disagreement after deciding not to step up the strike. If an agreement is reached, oil and gas production on shut-down fields could resume in a day or two, Statoil says (STO +4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • NOW

    Facebook's IPO hasn't done much to hurt demand for enterprise software offerings. After pricing...

    Facebook's IPO hasn't done much to hurt demand for enterprise software offerings. After pricing its 11.65M share IPO at $18 (above a prior range of $15-$17), ServiceNow (NYSE:NOW) opened at $23.75 and is currently trading at $23.01, up 27.8%. The company's cloud solutions have been gaining share in the systems management software market, and the bidding war for peer Quest Software may have heightened investor interest. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • DWDP

    Dow Chemical (DOW +1.4%) and Turkish acrylics manufacturer Aksa Akrilik Kimya Sanayii announce...

    Dow Chemical (DOW +1.4%) and Turkish acrylics manufacturer Aksa Akrilik Kimya Sanayii announce the formation of DowAksa Advanced Composites Holdings, a joint venture to manufacture and market carbon fiber and derivatives. The combined company plans to develop and globally market a broad range of products and technical support to service the rapidly expanding carbon-fiber composites industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY +3.3%) trades higher after announcing that it completed its tender off...

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY +3.3%) trades higher after announcing that it completed its tender off for Cost Plus and catching an analyst upgrade by BB&T from Buy to Hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • VMW

    VMware (VMW +6.8%) is among today's tech standouts after FBR says its checks indicate business...

    VMware (VMW +6.8%) is among today's tech standouts after FBR says its checks indicate business is good, in spite of the impact of macro issues on IT spending. F5 (FFIV +5.6%), whose switches often interface with servers running VMware's virtualization sosftware, is also up sharply, reversing yesterday's 4% drop.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 3 Comments
  • TAHO

    Tahoe Resources (TAHO +10.1%) shares bounce back nicely after yesterday's 26% plunge on chatter...

    Tahoe Resources (TAHO +10.1%) shares bounce back nicely after yesterday's 26% plunge on chatter that Guatemala would change the wording in its constitution, which might have adversely impacted the company's operations in the country. TAHO said proposed mining law reforms should not affect its Escobal project.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • GEF

    Greif (GEF +4.7%) moves up today on a Well Fargo upgrade to Outperform on valuation, citing...

    Greif (GEF +4.7%) moves up today on a Well Fargo upgrade to Outperform on valuation, citing stabilized demand trends, a solid 4.3% dividend yield and improving cash flow metrics. The firm has a $46 - $48 price target range on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • AMCX

    Shares of AMC Networks (AMCX +0.1%) trade flat after Dish Networks (DISH +2.9%) calls its bluff...

    Shares of AMC Networks (AMCX +0.1%) trade flat after Dish Networks (DISH +2.9%) calls its bluff and says it will drop three of its channels from its lineup of programming tonight. On the other side of the coin, Dish is airing its own commercial-free programming on the trio of networks and will take a bit of a revenue hit as it gambles that it will gain it all back and more if it secures a lower fee structure from AMC in the future.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • CYH

    Wells Fargo raises its rating on a number of hospital stocks stock this morning, saying the...

    Wells Fargo raises its rating on a number of hospital stocks stock this morning, saying the shares are "significantly undervalued" given the Supreme Court decision yesterday and will benefit significantly from expanded insurance coverage. The firm upgrades Community Health (CYH +2.5%), Tenet Healthcare (THC +1.7%), and Vanguard Health Systems (VHS +7.5%) all to Outperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • NAV

    Navistar (NAV +6.6%) shoots higher again amid more chatter related to a potential takeover. It's...

    Navistar (NAV +6.6%) shoots higher again amid more chatter related to a potential takeover. It's been a common theme as of late with a lot of block trading building up, but a skeptical Herb Greenberg tweets a warning to NAV investors on getting caught up in the action.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • AA

    Alcoa (AA +2.1%) agrees to sell its Tapoco Hydroelectric Project in Tennessee and North Carolina...

    Alcoa (AA +2.1%) agrees to sell its Tapoco Hydroelectric Project in Tennessee and North Carolina to Brookfield Renewable Energy Partners (BRPFF.PK) for $600M. The transaction includes four generating stations and dams, 86 miles of transmission line, and ~14.5K acres of land associated with Tapoco.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • GD

    General Dynamics (GD +3.5%) acquires the Ship Repair and Coatings Division of Earl Industries, a...

    General Dynamics (GD +3.5%) acquires the Ship Repair and Coatings Division of Earl Industries, a ship repair company that supports the U.S. Navy fleet in Norfolk, Virginia and Mayport, Florida. The financial terms were not disclosed, but GD expects the deal to be accretive to earnings in FY13.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • RGR

    Shares of Sturm Ruger (RGR +6.1%) rally after peer Smith & Wesson (SWHC +15.2%) beats profit...

    Shares of Sturm Ruger (RGR +6.1%) rally after peer Smith & Wesson (SWHC +15.2%) beats profit estimates and ups its FY13 guidance. Political news can frequently drive gun stocks, but this time around it was good ole fashioned sales numbers that did the trick.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • BB

    Following Research In Motion's (RIMM -15%) FQ1 miss, discussion is shifting from market share...

    Following Research In Motion's (RIMM -15%) FQ1 miss, discussion is shifting from market share losses to the company's survival. Canaccord's Mike Walkley thinks the hardware business now has a negative gross margin, and expects a sale to eventually happen. BofA, which is downgrading RIM to Underperform, declares "the risk of total value destruction" a possibility. Wedge Partners' Brian Blair argues RIM can only survive as a low-end/emerging markets vendor. (MSFT offer) (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM | 4 Comments
  • YUM

    Yum Brands (YUM -2.5%) sits out the broad market rally and trades lower, as investors could be...

    Yum Brands (YUM -2.5%) sits out the broad market rally and trades lower, as investors could be worrying about the company's growth in China after Nike's disappointing FQ4 report sets a gloomy tone.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • BP

    Settlement talks between the Justice Department, BP (BP +3.2%) and Transocean (RIG +3.3%) over...

    Settlement talks between the Justice Department, BP (BP +3.2%) and Transocean (RIG +3.3%) over the Deepwater Horizon disaster are said to have picked up speed in recent weeks. BP could be subject to civil fines for violating the Clean Water Act ranging from $5.4B to $21B, and it could face another $28B in fines if the U.S. alleges criminal violations.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • LVS

    Accusations that Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) employed a "prostitution strategy" in Macau are...

    Accusations that Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) employed a "prostitution strategy" in Macau are getting the brush-off by investors who have bid up shares 3.3% premarket. The allegations have been floating about since 2010 and don't appears set to disrupt the company's plans in the region.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 3 Comments
  • CNX

    Consol Energy (NYSE:CNX) +2.5% premarket after announcing it will lay off 318 employees, or 3.4%...

    Consol Energy (NYSE:CNX) +2.5% premarket after announcing it will lay off 318 employees, or 3.4% of its workforce, citing the soft domestic coal market and the warm winter as it idles its Fola operations in West Virginia. CNX expects production to be reduced by ~800K tons of coal; so far in 2012, Fola has produced 1.05M tons.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • STZ

    Premarket gainers: STZ +18%. SWHC +13%. AMPE +12%. NBG +14%. FSIN +13%. PCX +9%. KBH +9%. ING...

    Premarket gainers: STZ +18%. SWHC +13%.
    AMPE +12%. NBG +14%. FSIN +13%. PCX +9%. KBH +9%. ING +8%. LXRX +8%. IRE +7%. BBVA +7%. DB +7%. IVN +7%. MTG +7%. ALU +7%. GSS +6%. LNCR +5%. RIO +6%. ATPG +6%. MT +6%. HZNP +6%. SAN +6%. CLNE +6%. STM +6%. CS +6%. BBL +5%. GALE +5%. OREX +7%. SI +5%. VALE +5%. BHP +5%.
    Losers: RIMM -14%. NKE -10%. TMH -7%. SPPI -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • CNVR

    ValueClick (VCLK) +9.9% after announcing it expects Q2 revenue to be at the high end of a...

    ValueClick (VCLK) +9.9% after announcing it expects Q2 revenue to be at the high end of a guidance range of $155M-$160M (consensus stands at $157.3M), and adjusted EBITDA at the high end of a range of $46M-$48M. The online ad services provider is also launching a new $100M stock buyback program, and increasing the size of its credit facility by $50M to $242.5M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • HEP

    Holly Energy Partners (NYSE:HEP) agrees to acquire HollyFrontier's (NYSE:HFC) 75% stake in UNEV...

    Holly Energy Partners (NYSE:HEP) agrees to acquire HollyFrontier's (NYSE:HFC) 75% stake in UNEV Pipeline for $315M, allowing HEP to continue its growth in tariff-based revenues and HFC to focus on its core operations. HFC also authorizes a $350M share buyback program. HFC +1.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • LXRX

    Lexicon Pharma (NASDAQ:LXRX) +6.2% premarket after publishing results of two studies of its...

    Lexicon Pharma (NASDAQ:LXRX) +6.2% premarket after publishing results of two studies of its LX4211 oral drug for type 2 diabetes in the journal Clinical Pharmacology & Therapeutics, adding to positive results released earlier this week.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • CLNE

    Clean Energy Fuels (NASDAQ:CLNE) +6.7% premarket on news it has begun providing natural gas fuel...

    Clean Energy Fuels (NASDAQ:CLNE) +6.7% premarket on news it has begun providing natural gas fuel to additional trucking fleets which transport products for several large and well-known brands, accelerating the trucking industry's conversion to natural gas fuel. Shares rose 4.4% yesterday after Capstone started coverage with a Buy rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • KBH

    KB Home (NYSE:KBH): FQ2 EPS of -$0.31 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $302.9M (+11% Y/Y) beats by...

    KB Home (NYSE:KBH): FQ2 EPS of -$0.31 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $302.9M (+11% Y/Y) beats by $1.6M. Shares +8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM

  • Constellation Brands soars 8.4% premarket after a dizzying array of company-related news hits....

    Constellation Brands soars 8.4% premarket after a dizzying array of company-related news hits. The company released a largely in-line FQ1 report and confirmed that it purchased the 50% of Crown Imports that it doesn't already own. But the biggest item may have been the confirmation that Anheuser-Busch InBev will buy Grupo Modelo as the company stands in line for a windfall related to a contract trigger that will be set off.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM
  • STZ

    Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ): Q1 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $635M (flat Y/Y)...

    Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ): Q1 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $635M (flat Y/Y) misses by $10M. Shares +8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM
  • FINL

    More on Finish Line's Q1 (NASDAQ:FINL): Comparable-store sales increased 8% Y/Y. Digital sales...

    More on Finish Line's Q1 (NASDAQ:FINL): Comparable-store sales increased 8% Y/Y. Digital sales +28.1% Y/Y. SG&A expenses up a point to 26.6%. Sees 5% to 6% comparable-store sales growth in FY13 and EPS increasing by 6%-7%. Shares -2.8% with Nike's earnings report as a backdrop. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM

  • Asset correlations seemingly near 1 (or -1) the last few years mean we can have higher stock...

    Asset correlations seemingly near 1 (or -1) the last few years mean we can have higher stock prices or lower oil prices, but not both. WTI crude rockets higher alongside stocks and stock futures this morning, +3.6% to $80.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:16 AM
  • F

    Citigroup removes Ford (NYSE:F) from its Top Picks Live list after the automaker warns of global...

    Citigroup removes Ford (NYSE:F) from its Top Picks Live list after the automaker warns of global losses. After initially surviving weakness in the European auto market better than rivals, Ford now faces the same tough choices on downsizing on the continent. F -0.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:54 AM | 5 Comments
  • SHOO

    Shoe sellers are on watch today to see if investors sell off the names on the same margin...

    Shoe sellers are on watch today to see if investors sell off the names on the same margin concerns stirred up by Nike's FQ4 earnings report. Premarket: SHOO -0.2%, CROX -0.5%, DECK -1.1%, SKX inactive.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 AM
  • NKE

    Citigroup defends Buy-rated Nike (NYSE:NKE) after its FQ4 showed a worse-than-expected profit on higher spending and increased material costs.
